original_solution_mapping.L1: Ali made 5 circles with 8 boxes each so he used 5*8 = <<5*8=40>>40 boxes
original_solution_mapping.L2: There were 80 boxes to start with so now there are 80-40 = <<80-40=40>>40 boxes left
original_solution_mapping.L3: Ernie used 10 boxes to make one circle so with 40 boxes he can make 40/10 = <<40/10=4>>4 circles

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5998.
    Returns: the number of circles Ernie can make.
    """
    # L1
    ali_circles = 5 # Ali makes 5 circles
    boxes_per_ali_circle = 8 # Ali used 8 boxes to make each of his circles
    ali_boxes_used = ali_circles * boxes_per_ali_circle

    # L2
    initial_boxes = 80 # they had 80 boxes to begin with
    remaining_boxes = initial_boxes - ali_boxes_used

    # L3
    boxes_per_ernie_circle = 10 # Ernie used 10 for his
    ernie_circles_made = remaining_boxes / boxes_per_ernie_circle

    # FA
    answer = ernie_circles_made
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Ali made {ali_circles} circles with {boxes_per_ali_circle} boxes each so he used {ali_circles}*{boxes_per_ali_circle} = <<{ali_circles}*{boxes_per_ali_circle}={ali_boxes_used}>>{ali_boxes_used} boxes
There were {initial_boxes} boxes to start with so now there are {initial_boxes}-{ali_boxes_used} = <<{initial_boxes}-{ali_boxes_used}={remaining_boxes}>>{remaining_boxes} boxes left

Ernie used {boxes_per_ernie_circle} boxes to make one circle so with {remaining_boxes} boxes he can make {remaining_boxes}/{boxes_per_ernie_circle} = <<{remaining_boxes}/{boxes_per_ernie_circle}={ernie_circles_made}>>{ernie_circles_made} circles

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Ali made 5 circles with 8 boxes each so he used 5*8 = <<5*8=40>>40 boxes

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'ali_boxes_used' (value: 40) was reported instead of 'ernie_circles_made' (value: 4.0).
